Greatest common divisor of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a finite set

For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number δ, the set {x : E | ∥x∥ ≤ δ ∨ x ∈ s} equals the set {x : E | ∥x - o ∥ ≤ δ}, where o is the origin of E.

type: ∀ {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] (δ : ℝ) (s : Set E), Metric.ball 0 δ + s = Metric.thickening δ s
name: ball_add_zero
docString: For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number δ, the set {x : E | ∥x∥ ≤ δ ∨ x ∈ s} equals the set {x : E | ∥x - o ∥ ≤ δ}, where o is the origin of E.

This theorem states that for every pair of natural numbers `m` and `n`, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `m` and `n` divides `n`. In mathematical notation, this can be written as: "For all m, n in ℕ, gcd(m, n) ∣ n". This is a fundamental property of the gcd in number theory.

type: ∀ (m n : ℕ), m.gcd n ∣ n
name: Nat.gcd_dvd_right
docString: This theorem states that for every pair of natural numbers `m` and `n`, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `m` and `n` divides `n`. In mathematical notation, this can be written as: "For all m, n in ℕ, gcd(m, n) ∣ n". This is a fundamental property of the gcd in number theory.

Greatest common divisor of a multiset

type: {α : Type u_1} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Multiset α → α
name: Multiset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a multiset

For a continuous function `f` on `[0,1]`, given `ε > 0`, `n > 0`, `x ∈ [0,1]`, `k ∈ [0,1]` not in `S` where `S = {k/n | k ∈ ℕ, |k/n - x| < δ}`, and `δ` is the modulus of continuity for `f` such that `|f(x) - f(y)| < ε/2` for `|x - y| < δ`, the inequality `1 ≤ δ² * (x - k/n)²` holds.

type:
∀ {f : C(↑unitInterval, ℝ)} {ε : ℝ} {h : 0 < ε} {n : ℕ} {x : ↑unitInterval} {k : Fin (n + 1)},
  k ∈ (bernsteinApproximation.S f ε h n x)ᶜ → 1 ≤ bernsteinApproximation.δ f ε h ^ (-2) * (↑x - ↑(bernstein.z k)) ^ 2
name: bernsteinApproximation.le_of_mem_S_compl
docString: For a continuous function `f` on `[0,1]`, given `ε > 0`, `n > 0`, `x ∈ [0,1]`, `k ∈ [0,1]` not in `S` where `S = {k/n | k ∈ ℕ, |k/n - x| < δ}`, and `δ` is the modulus of continuity for `f` such that `|f(x) - f(y)| < ε/2` for `|x - y| < δ`, the inequality `1 ≤ δ² * (x - k/n)²` holds.

This theorem states that for any natural number `n` and any unit `u` from the group of units of integers modulo `n` (denoted as `(ZMod n)ˣ`), the value of `u` (obtained using the `ZMod.val` function and then coercing `u` to integer) is coprime with `n`. In other words, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `ZMod.val ↑u` and `n` is 1, meaning that they share no common factor other than 1.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ} (u : (ZMod n)ˣ), (↑u).val.Coprime n
name: ZMod.val_coe_unit_coprime
docString: This theorem states that for any natural number `n` and any unit `u` from the group of units of integers modulo `n` (denoted as `(ZMod n)ˣ`), the value of `u` (obtained using the `ZMod.val` function and then coercing `u` to integer) is coprime with `n`. In other words, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `ZMod.val ↑u` and `n` is 1, meaning that they share no common factor other than 1.

The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

name: PNat.gcd
docString:
The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

The integers modulo `n : ℕ`.

type: ℕ → Type
name: ZMod
docString: The integers modulo `n : ℕ`.

The discriminant `Δ'` of an elliptic curve over `R`, which is given as a unit in `R`.

type: {R : Type u} → [inst : CommRing R] → EllipticCurve R → Rˣ
name: EllipticCurve.Δ'
docString: The discriminant `Δ'` of an elliptic curve over `R`, which is given as a unit in `R`.

The multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the multiplicative
indicator of the set, as δ>0 tends to zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {β : Type u_2} [inst_1 : One β] [inst_2 : TopologicalSpace β] (f : α → β)
  (E : Set α),
  Filter.Tendsto (fun δ => Set.mulIndicator (Metric.thickening δ E) f) (nhdsWithin 0 (Set.Ioi 0))
    (nhds (Set.mulIndicator (closure E) f))
name: tendsto_mulIndicator_thickening_mulIndicator_closure
docString:
The multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the multiplicative
indicator of the set, as δ>0 tends to zero.

Pointwise, the multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set eventually coincide
with the multiplicative indicator of the set as δ>0 tends to zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {β : Type u_2} [inst_1 : One β] (f : α → β) (E : Set α) (x : α),
  ∀ᶠ (δ : ℝ) in nhdsWithin 0 (Set.Ioi 0),
    Set.mulIndicator (Metric.thickening δ E) f x = Set.mulIndicator (closure E) f x
name: mulIndicator_thickening_eventually_eq_mulIndicator_closure
docString:
Pointwise, the multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set eventually coincide
with the multiplicative indicator of the set as δ>0 tends to zero.

If `ξ` is an integer, all its convergents equal `ξ`.

type: ∀ {ξ : ℤ} (n : ℕ), Real.convergent (↑ξ) n = ↑ξ
name: Real.convergent_of_int
docString: If `ξ` is an integer, all its convergents equal `ξ`.

The Kronecker delta as a locally constant map from `π C (· ∈ s)` to `ℤ`.

type:
{I : Type u} →
  [inst : LinearOrder I] →
    (C : Set (I → Bool)) →
      (s : Finset I) →
        ↑(Profinite.NobelingProof.π C fun x => x ∈ s) → LocallyConstant ↑(Profinite.NobelingProof.π C fun x => x ∈ s) ℤ
name: Profinite.NobelingProof.spanFinBasis
docString: The Kronecker delta as a locally constant map from `π C (· ∈ s)` to `ℤ`.

Multiplication by positive integers is injective

type: ∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R] [self : BinomialRing R] (n : ℕ), n ≠ 0 → Function.Injective fun x => n • x
name: BinomialRing.nsmul_right_injective
docString: Multiplication by positive integers is injective

The modulus of (uniform) continuity for `f`, chosen so `|f x - f y| < ε/2` when `|x - y| < δ`.

type: C(↑unitInterval, ℝ) → (ε : ℝ) → 0 < ε → ℝ
name: bernsteinApproximation.δ
docString: The modulus of (uniform) continuity for `f`, chosen so `|f x - f y| < ε/2` when `|x - y| < δ`.

The greatest common divisor between two elements.

type: {α : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [self : GCDMonoid α] → α → α → α
name: GCDMonoid.gcd
docString: The greatest common divisor between two elements.

The Dirac delta distribution

type:
(𝕜 : Type u_1) →
  {E : Type u_4} →
    (F : Type u_5) →
      [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] →
        [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ E] →
          [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup F] →
            [inst_3 : NormedSpace ℝ F] →
              [inst_4 : IsROrC 𝕜] →
                [inst_5 : NormedSpace 𝕜 F] → [inst_6 : SMulCommClass ℝ 𝕜 F] → E → SchwartzMap E F →L[𝕜] F
name: SchwartzMap.delta
docString: The Dirac delta distribution

Every x greater than or equal to 1 is between two successive
natural-number powers of every y greater than one.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : LinearOrderedSemiring α] [inst_1 : Archimedean α] [inst_2 : ExistsAddOfLE α] {x y : α},
  1 ≤ x → 1 < y → ∃ n, y ^ n ≤ x ∧ x < y ^ (n + 1)
name: exists_nat_pow_near
docString:
Every x greater than or equal to 1 is between two successive
natural-number powers of every y greater than one.

the Hilbert epsilon Function

type: {α : Sort u} → [h : Nonempty α] → (α → Prop) → α
name: Classical.epsilon
docString: the Hilbert epsilon Function

A prime natural number is prime in `ℤ[i]` if and only if it is `3` mod `4`

type: ∀ (p : ℕ) [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], Prime ↑p ↔ p % 4 = 3
name: GaussianInt.prime_iff_mod_four_eq_three_of_nat_prime
docString: A prime natural number is prime in `ℤ[i]` if and only if it is `3` mod `4`

For `d ∣ n`, the totient of `n/d` equals the number of values `k < n` such that `gcd n k = d`

type: ∀ {n d : ℕ}, d ∣ n → Nat.totient (n / d) = (Finset.filter (fun k => Nat.gcd n k = d) (Finset.range n)).card
name: Nat.totient_div_of_dvd
docString: For `d ∣ n`, the totient of `n/d` equals the number of values `k < n` such that `gcd n k = d`

The proposition that a sequence indexed by integers is a divisibility sequence.

type: {R : Type u} → [inst : CommRing R] → (ℤ → R) → Prop
name: IsDivSequence
docString: The proposition that a sequence indexed by integers is a divisibility sequence.

If a solution has `x > 1`, then `d` is positive.

type: ∀ {d : ℤ} {a : Pell.Solution₁ d}, 1 < Pell.Solution₁.x a → 0 < d
name: Pell.Solution₁.d_pos_of_one_lt_x
docString: If a solution has `x > 1`, then `d` is positive.

The divisors of a product of natural numbers are the pointwise product of the divisors of the
factors.

type: ∀ (m n : ℕ), Nat.divisors (m * n) = Nat.divisors m * Nat.divisors n
name: Nat.divisors_mul
docString:
The divisors of a product of natural numbers are the pointwise product of the divisors of the
factors.
